cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 975 mi ESE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the southwestern Atlantic toward the coasts of North and South Carolina, aiming for the Cape Fear–Cape Lookout area
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cape Fear / Wilmington, North Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach, SC northward to the North Carolina-Virginia border including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued yet (only watches in effect)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire North Carolina and northern South Carolina coastline, especially Cape Fear to Cape Lookout and the Pamlico/Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (89%) of tropical-storm-force winds, with 65% chance of sustained 50-kt and roughly 41% chance of hurricane-force (64-kt) winds at or near Wilmington.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Peak surge of 6–12 ft possible from Cape Fear to Cape Lookout, which includes the Wilmington area.
weather_observation.rainfall: 15–20 inches with isolated totals up to 30 inches possible near and just inland from landfall, producing life-threatening flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very large breaking surf, dangerous rip currents, coastal erosion, and possible prolonged river/estuarine flooding that could disrupt port operations and access routes.
